arm_group.arm_group_label: CT Marking and VATS lung wedge resection
arm_group.description: Each patient with a lung nodule meeting criteria will undergo marking with fiducials followed at the same time by Video-Assisted Thoracic Surgery (VATS) lung wedge resection under CT fluoroscopy.

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a phase II protocol to determine the safety and feasibility of Intraoperative CT
      fluoroscopy guidance for lung resection for small nodules.

clinical_study.brief_title: Percutaneous Image Guided Video-Assisted Thoracic Surgery (VATS) Resection of Lung Lesions

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a phase II protocol to determine the safety and feasibility of image guided CT
      marking for resection of small lung nodules.  This is relevant because many such nodules are
      hard to localize for minimally invasive lung resection.  It is hoped that this technology
      using fluoro CT capability available now in most operating room will improve safety and
      reliability of thoracic surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  peripheral lung nodules < 3cm in size

          -  Surgical candidate

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Non surgical candidate

intervention.arm_group_label: CT Marking and VATS lung wedge resection
intervention.other_name: Nodules marked with fiducials such as Kopan needles under CT fluoroscopy followed by VATS wedge resection.

clinical_study.official_title: Percutaneous Image Guided Video Assisted Thoracic Surgery (VATS) Resection of Lung Lesions

primary_outcome.description: The patient will be monitored while in the hospital by their thoracic surgical team as well as by two research nurses named Lauren Donahue, RN and Karen Magsipoc, NP. The research nurses will document any perioperative complications and mortality that arise during the patient's stay in the hospital.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Associate Chief of Thoracic Surgery; Professor of Surgery

secondary_outcome.description: Accurate and appropriate resection in a given timeline

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
